00138     public function Start ( )
00139     // User's manual :
00140     //Start the application
00141         //Call the call back function set up by OnApplicationStart
00142         //
00143         // Returns :
00144         //- null if application successfully started
00145         //- an object of type Errors in case of error(s)
00146         //
00147     // Contract :
00148     //
00149         {
00150                 if ( $this->started )
00151                 {
00152                         $errors = new Errors ();
00153                         $errors->Add ( new ApplicationError ( ApplicationError::ALREADY_STARTED, 'Application has been already started.' ) );
00154                         
00155                         return $errors;
00156                 }
00157         
00158                 // get launchTime in microseconds
00159                 $this->systemVars[ self::SYSTEM_START_TIME ] = microtime ( true );
00160                 
00161                 // set up call back function for the end of the application
00162                 register_shutdown_function ( $this->onApplicationEnd, $this->systemVars );
00163 
00164                 return $this->launchCallBack ( 'onApplicationStart' );
00165         } // End of Start
00166         
00167     public function OnApplicationStart ( $function, $params )
00168     // User's manual :
00169     //Set up call_back function for Application Start.
00170         //The $function will be called when Start() will
00171         //
00172         //$function is the name of the function to be called
00173         //$params must be an array of parameters for the function
00174         //
00175         //For calling method of a class, use array (& $obj, 'method_name')
00176         //
00177         // Returns :
00178         //- return an object of Errors' type in case of Error(s)
00179         //- null instead
00180         //
00181         //
00182         // Errors may be composed by :
00183         // - ApplicationError::FUNCTION_NOT_CALLABLE;
00184         // - ApplicationError::FUNCTION_PARAM_NOT_ARRAY;
00185         // - ApplicationError::CALLBACK_NOT_EXISTS;
00186         //
00187     // Contract :
00188     //
00189         {
00190                 return $this->setCallBack ( 'onApplicationStart', $function, $params ) ;
00191         }
00192         
00193     public function OnApplicationEnd ( $function )
00194     // User's manual :
00195     //Set up call_back function for Application End.
00196         //The $function will be called when Script will be stopped
00197         //
00198         //$function is the name of the function to be called
00199         //$function may accept 1 argument. This argument will be an array of system variables
00200         //Please look at the definition of systemVars
00201         //
00202         //For calling method of a class, use array (& $obj, 'method_name')
00203         //
00204         // Returns :
00205         //- return an object of Errors' type in case of Error(s)
00206         //- null instead
00207         //
00208         //
00209         // Errors may be composed by :
00210         // - ApplicationError::FUNCTION_NOT_CALLABLE;
00211         // - ApplicationError::FUNCTION_PARAM_NOT_ARRAY;
00212         // - ApplicationError::CALLBACK_NOT_EXISTS;
00213         //
00214     // Contract :
00215     //
00216         {
00217                 $falseArray = array();
00218                         $errors = $this->setCallBack ( 'onApplicationEnd', $function, $falseArray ) ;
00219                 unset( $falseArray );
00220                 
00221                 if ( $errors InstanceOf Errors )
00222                 {
00223                         return $errors;
00224                 }
00225 
00226                 return null;
00227         }

00230     protected function __construct()
00231     // User's manual :
00232     //Internal constructor that disable instanciation
00233     // Contract :
00234     //
00235     {
00236                 $this->configuration = new Variables ( new BDDRecordSet() );
00237                 $this->started = false;
00238                 
00239                 $this->systemVars = array( );
00240         
00241                 $this->onApplicationStart = -1;
00242                 $this->onApplicationStartParams = -1;
00243                 
00244                 $this->onApplicationEnd = -1;
00245                 $this->onApplicationEndParams = -1;
00246                 
00247                 $this->var_globals = & $GLOBALS;
00248                 $this->var_post = & $_POST;
00249                 $this->var_get = & $_GET;
00250                 $this->var_files = & $_FILES;

00276 //------------------------------------------------------ protected methods
00277     // protected type Méthode ( );
00278     // User's manual :
00279     //
00280     // Contract :
00281     //
00282         
00283         protected function isCorrectCallBack ( & $function, & $params, Errors $errors )
00284         // User's manual :
00285         //Let us know if a $function and it's $params are good to form a 
00286         //call back function
00287         //
00288         // Returns :
00289         //- true if the function can be set as CallBack
00290         //- false instead
00291         //
00292         // Contract :
00293         //$errors must be not null
00294         {       
00295                 // function incorrect or doesn't have good scope
00296                 if ( !is_callable( $function ) )
00297                 {
00298                         $errors->Add ( new ApplicationError ( ApplicationError::FUNCTION_NOT_CALLABLE, 'Incorrect function or scope.') );
00299                 }
00300                 
00301                 // params not an array
00302                 if ( !is_array( $params ) )
00303                 {
00304                         $errors->Add ( new ApplicationError ( ApplicationError::FUNCTION_PARAM_NOT_ARRAY, 'Params of the function must be an array.') );                
00305                 }
00306                 
00307                 return ( $errors->GetCount () == 0 );
00308         } // End of isCorrectCallBack
00309         
00310         protected function setCallBack ( $callBackName, & $function, & $params )
00311         // User's manual :
00312         //Let us know if a $function and its $params are good to form a 
00313         //call back function
00314         //
00315         // Returns :
00316         //- return an object of Errors' type in case of Error(s)
00317         //- null instead
00318         //
00319         //
00320         // Errors may be composed by :
00321         // - ApplicationError::FUNCTION_NOT_CALLABLE;
00322         // - ApplicationError::FUNCTION_PARAM_NOT_ARRAY
00323         // - ApplicationError::CALLBACK_NOT_EXISTS
00324         //
00325         // Contract :
00326         //
00327         {                       
00328                 $errors = new Errors();
00329                 
00330                 if ( $this->isCorrectCallBack( $function , $params, $errors ) === false )
00331                 // if we had some errors
00332                 {
00333                         return $errors;
00334                 }
00335 
00336                 if ( ! IsSet ( $this->{$callBackName} ) || ! IsSet ( $this->{$callBackName.'Params'} ) )
00337                 {
00338                         $errors->Add ( new ApplicationError ( ApplicationError::CALLBACK_NOT_EXISTS, 'You tried to set up a callback that doesn\'t exists.') );
00339                         
00340                         return $errors;
00341                 }
00342                 
00343                 // association
00344                 $this->{$callBackName} = $function;
00345                 $this->{$callBackName.'Params'} = $params;
00346                 
00347                 unset ( $errors );
00348                 
00349                 return null;
00350         } // End of setCallBack
00351         
00352         protected function launchCallBack ( $callBackName )
00353         // User's manual :
00354         //Launch CallBack function that names $callBackName
00355         //
00356         // Returns :
00357         //- return an object of Errors' type in case of Error(s)
00358         //- null instead
00359         //
00360         //
00361         // Errors may be composed by :
00362         //
00363         // Contract :
00364         //
00365         {
00366                 // launch start call_back function if set
00367                 if ( @$this->{ $callBackName } !== -1 )
00368                 {
00369                         call_user_func_array ( $this->{ $callBackName }, $this->{ $callBackName.'Params' } );
00370                         
00371                         return null;
00372                 }
00373                 else
00374                 {
00375                         $errors = new Errors();
00376                         $errors->Add ( new ApplicationError ( ApplicationError::CALLBACK_NOT_SET, 'You are trying to launch an unset callback function.') );
00377                         
00378                         return $errors;
00379                 }
00380         } // End of launchCallBack
